noun.description: Writing arranged with a metrical rhythm, typically having a rhyme.

verb.description: Speak in or compose verse; versify.
examples: he began to verse extemporaneously in her ear
thou sat all day, playing on pipes and versing love

origin: Old English fers, from Latin versus a turn of the plow, a furrow, a line of writing, from vertere to turn; reinforced in Middle English by Old French vers, from Latin versus.
